challenge1.title: Check Odd/Even
challenge1.question: Write a program to check if the entered integer is odd or even.

task.task1: Enter an integer input for the variable number.
task.task2: Check if it is even or odd using if...else
task.task3: If the integer is exactly divisible by 2, print Even. Else, print Odd.

challenge2.title: Print Fibonacci Numbers Less Than n
challenge2.question: Write a program to print fibonacci numbers where last term is less than n.
challenge2.hint: A Fibonacci sequence is a series of numbers where a number is the addition of the last two numbers. For example, 1 1 2 3 5

task.task1: Take integer input from the user and store it in n.
task.task2: Define two integer variables t1 and t2 both with the value of 1.
task.task3: Run a while loop as long as t1 is less than n.
task.task4: In each iteration, print the value of t1.
task.task5: Also, define the result variable as the sum of t1 and t2.
task.task6: Assign the value of t2 to t1.
task.task7: Assign the value of result to t2.

challenge3.title: Sum of Natural Numbers using Function
challenge3.question: Write a program to find the sum of N natural numbers by creating a function.

task.task1: Define a function named find_sum() that takes n as an argument.
task.task2: Inside the function, compute the sum of numbers from 1 to n and return the total.
task.task3: Outside the function, get an integer input for a variable number.
task.task4: Call the function and pass number as an argument and print the return value.

challenge4.title: Smallest Among Three Numbers
challenge4.question: Write a program to find the smallest among three numbers.
challenge4.hint: A Fibonacci sequence is a series of numbers where a number is the addition of the last two numbers. For example, 1 1 2 3 5

task.task1: Take three integer inputs and store them in number1, number2, and number2.
task.task2: Print the smallest number between them using if...elif...else statement.
